alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:19AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Pottawattamie, southeastern Harrison, southeastern Washington and eastern Douglas Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 519 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southeastern Omaha, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Omaha, western Council Bluffs, Bellevue, Carter Lake, Missouri Valley, Logan, Crescent, Aksarben, Benson, Florence, Eppley Airfield, South Omaha, Midtown, Hitchcock Nature Center, Historical Village Welcome Center and Narrows River Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 50 and 75. Interstate 80 in Iowa near mile marker 1. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 448 and 454. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
